intro: Barnadesia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
